content.description:
Microsoft (MSFT) reported fiscal second quarter results on Wednesday. Investors are concerned about the company's slowing cloud growth and increased capital expenditures (CapEx) spending.

RBC Capital Markets managing director of software Rishi Jaluria sits down with Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman to discuss Microsoft's spending, artificial intelligence (AI) monetization, and more.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.summary: Three mega-cap tech companies reported earnings on Wednesday, and the market’s verdict was swift and brutal for one company while two Magnificent 7 members received stamps of approval. Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) beat estimates with $4.14 in adjusted earnings. Meta (NASDAQ:META) crushed expectations with $8.88 EPS versus $8.18 estimated, rallying 9% in a week. Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) reported ... Why Investors Rewarded Meta and Tesla But Punished Microsoft Despite Revenue Beat
content.title: Why Investors Rewarded Meta and Tesla But Punished Microsoft Despite Revenue Beat

content.summary: It’s a fact of life in the financial markets: sometimes stocks go up, and sometimes they go down. When stocks go down sharply, people want to know why it happens — and Jim Cramer, host of the Mad Money television program, may be able to shed some light on this. Surely, people had burning questions ... Cramer Reminds Panicked Investors: “Stocks Don’t Go Down Because People Are in a Bad Mood”
content.title: Cramer Reminds Panicked Investors: “Stocks Don’t Go Down Because People Are in a Bad Mood”
